result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:04 PM Defendant Jennifer L. Diaz in court.  Attorney Brian David Van Ells in court for Jennifer L. Diaz.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Inducement made.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over for further proceedings.  Arraignment held. Defendant waives the reading of the Information. Not guilty plea entered to the charge(s) contained in the Information. Defendant waives right to substitution.  States offer to be given to defense/defendant by July 8, 2022.
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:43 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jennifer L. Diaz in court.  Attorney Brian David Van Ells in court for Jennifer L. Diaz. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Brian VanElls is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county pursuant to the standard collection practices of the Clerk of Court office.
Initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Re:  Possess fentanyl, 2nd & subsequent offense, on 03-29-22.
Order to report to MCSD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess drug paraphernalia, possess methamphetamine and possess schedule I or II narcotics.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-18-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
